geodir_sanitize_html_field()

geodirectory/includes/formatting-functions.php : 413

Filters content and keeps only allowable HTML elements.

geodir_sanitize_html_field(string $str[, array<string|int, mixed> $allowed_html = NULL ]) : string

This function makes sure that only the allowed HTML element names, attribute names and attribute values plus only sane HTML entities will occur in $string. You have to remove any slashes from PHP's magic quotes before you call this function.

The default allowed protocols are 'http', 'https', 'ftp', 'mailto', 'news', 'irc', 'gopher', 'nntp', 'feed', 'telnet, 'mms', 'rtsp' and 'svn'. This covers all common link protocols, except for 'javascript' which should not be allowed for untrusted users.

Parameters
$str : string

Content to filter through kses

$allowed_html : array<string|int, mixed> = NULL

List of allowed HTML elements. Default NULL.

Tags
since
2.0.0

geodir_filter_title_variables()

geodirectory/includes/general-functions.php : 1718

Filter the title variables.

geodir_filter_title_variables(string $title, string $gd_page[, string $sep = '' ]) : string

%%date%% Replaced with the date of the post/page %%title%% Replaced with the title of the post/page %%sitename%% The site's name %%sitedesc%% The site's tagline / description %%excerpt%% Replaced with the post/page excerpt (or auto-generated if it does not exist) %%tag%% Replaced with the current tag/tags %%category%% Replaced with the post categories (comma separated) %%category_description%% Replaced with the category description %%tag_description%% Replaced with the tag description %%term_description%% Replaced with the term description %%term_title%% Replaced with the term name %%searchphrase%% Replaced with the current search phrase %%sep%% The separator defined in your theme's wp_title() tag.

ADVANCED %%pt_single%% Replaced with the post type single label %%pt_plural%% Replaced with the post type plural label %%modified%% Replaced with the post/page modified time %%id%% Replaced with the post/page ID %%name%% Replaced with the post/page author's 'nicename' %%userid%% Replaced with the post/page author's userid %%page%% Replaced with the current page number (i.e. page 2 of 4) %%pagetotal%% Replaced with the current page total %%postcount%% Replaced with the current post found

%%pagenumber%% Replaced with the current page number

Parameters
$title : string

The title with variables.

$gd_page : string

The page being filtered.

$sep : string = ''

The separator, default: |.

Tags
since
1.5.7
global

object $wp WordPress object.

global

object $post The current post object.

geodir_excerpt()

geodirectory/includes/helper-functions.php : 786

Truncates the text.

geodir_excerpt(string $text[, int $length = 100 ][, array<string|int, mixed> $options = array() ]) : string

Cuts a string to the length of $length and replaces the last characters with the ellipsis if the text is longer than length.

Parameters
$text : string

String to truncate.

$length : int = 100

Length of returned string, including ellipsis.

$options : array<string|int, mixed> = array()

{ An array of HTML attributes and options.

@type string $ellipsis Will be used as ending and appended to the trimmed string. Ex: "...".
@type bool   $exact If false, $text will not be cut mid-word.
@type bool   $html If true, HTML tags would be handled correctly.
@type bool   $trimWidth If true, $text will be truncated with the width.

}

Tags
since
1.6.16
